scenarios.scenario_name: Approve document with single reviewer

executions.scenario_name: Approve document with single reviewer

steps.description: Given a document in "review" status with one assigned reviewer
When the reviewer approves the document
Then the document status changes to "approved"
And the approval is recorded with a timestamp

scenarios.scenario_name: Create document as draft

executions.scenario_name: Create document as draft

steps.description: Given a user with author permissions
When they create a new document
Then the document is created with status "draft"
And the document is assigned to the author

scenarios.scenario_name: Invalid state transitions return errors

executions.scenario_name: Invalid state transitions return errors

steps.description: Given a document in "approved" status
When any user attempts to submit it for review
Then the transition is rejected
And a descriptive error is returned indicating the transition is not allowed

scenarios.scenario_name: Prevent edits to approved documents

executions.scenario_name: Prevent edits to approved documents

steps.description: Given a document in "approved" status
When any user attempts to edit the document
Then the edit is rejected
And an error is returned indicating the document is locked

scenarios.scenario_name: Prevent edits to documents under review

executions.scenario_name: Prevent edits to documents under review

steps.description: Given a document in "review" status
When the author attempts to edit the document
Then the edit is rejected
And an error is returned indicating the document is under review

scenarios.scenario_name: Reject document with reason

executions.scenario_name: Reject document with reason

steps.description: Given a document in "review" status
When a reviewer rejects the document
Then the document status changes to "rejected"
And the rejection reason is recorded

scenarios.scenario_name: Submit document for review

executions.scenario_name: Submit document for review

steps.description: Given a document in "draft" status
When the author submits it for review
Then the document status changes to "review"
And all assigned reviewers are notified

scenarios.scenario_name: Prevent duplicate approval from same reviewer

executions.scenario_name: Prevent duplicate approval from same reviewer

steps.description: Given a reviewer who has already approved a document
When they attempt to approve the same document again
Then the request is rejected
And an error is returned indicating they have already submitted a decision

scenarios.scenario_name: Reject if any reviewer rejects

executions.scenario_name: Reject if any reviewer rejects

steps.description: Given a document in "review" status with multiple reviewers
When one reviewer rejects the document
Then the document status changes to "rejected"
And remaining reviewers are no longer required to act

scenarios.scenario_name: Require all assigned reviewers to approve

executions.scenario_name: Require all assigned reviewers to approve

steps.description: Given a document in "review" status with three assigned reviewers
When only two reviewers have approved
Then the document remains in "review" status
And the pending reviewer is visible in the status response

scenarios.scenario_name: Reviewer decisions are immutable

executions.scenario_name: Reviewer decisions are immutable

steps.description: Given a reviewer who has already approved a document
When they attempt to reject the same document
Then the request is rejected
And an error is returned indicating their decision cannot be changed

scenarios.scenario_name: Track individual reviewer decisions with timestamps

executions.scenario_name: Track individual reviewer decisions with timestamps

steps.description: Given a document in "review" status
When a reviewer submits their decision
Then the decision is recorded with the reviewer ID and timestamp
And the decision is visible in the document review history

scenarios.scenario_name: Delegate review to substitute with expiry date

executions.scenario_name: Delegate review to substitute with expiry date

steps.description: Given a reviewer assigned to a document
When they delegate to a substitute with an expiry date
Then the substitute is granted review permissions for that document
And the delegation record includes the expiry timestamp

scenarios.scenario_name: Delegator can revoke delegation before expiry

executions.scenario_name: Delegator can revoke delegation before expiry

steps.description: Given an active delegation
When the delegator revokes the delegation
Then the substitute loses review permissions immediately
And subsequent actions by the substitute are rejected

scenarios.scenario_name: Expired delegation is rejected

executions.scenario_name: Expired delegation is rejected

steps.description: Given a delegation that has passed its expiry date
When the substitute attempts to approve the document
Then the approval is rejected
And an error is returned indicating the delegation has expired

scenarios.scenario_name: One active delegation per reviewer per document

executions.scenario_name: One active delegation per reviewer per document

steps.description: Given a reviewer with an existing active delegation for a document
When they attempt to create another delegation for the same document
Then the delegation is rejected
And an error is returned indicating an active delegation already exists

scenarios.scenario_name: Prevent delegation chain

executions.scenario_name: Prevent delegation chain

steps.description: Given a substitute who has been delegated review authority
When the substitute attempts to delegate to another person
Then the delegation is rejected
And an error is returned indicating re-delegation is not permitted

scenarios.scenario_name: Substitute can approve on behalf of delegator

executions.scenario_name: Substitute can approve on behalf of delegator

steps.description: Given a valid delegation that has not expired
When the substitute approves the document
Then the approval is recorded as the substitute acting on behalf of the delegator
And the delegator's review requirement is satisfied

scenarios.scenario_name: Auto-escalate after configurable timeout

executions.scenario_name: Auto-escalate after configurable timeout

steps.description: Given a document in "review" status
When the configured timeout period elapses without all reviewers acting
Then the document is escalated to the next-level approver
And the escalation is recorded with a timestamp

scenarios.scenario_name: Escalation notifies next-level approver

executions.scenario_name: Escalation notifies next-level approver

steps.description: Given a document that has been escalated
When the escalation is triggered
Then the next-level approver is added to the reviewer list
And a notification is generated for the new approver

scenarios.scenario_name: Escalation resets timeout for new approver

executions.scenario_name: Escalation resets timeout for new approver

steps.description: Given a document that has been escalated to a new approver
When the escalation is processed
Then a new timeout period begins for the escalated approver
And the original timeout is no longer active

scenarios.scenario_name: Maximum escalation depth is enforced

executions.scenario_name: Maximum escalation depth is enforced

steps.description: Given a document that has already been escalated to the maximum depth
When the escalation timeout elapses again
Then no further escalation occurs
And an error or warning is logged indicating max depth reached

scenarios.scenario_name: Original reviewer can still approve before escalation triggers

executions.scenario_name: Original reviewer can still approve before escalation triggers

steps.description: Given a document approaching the escalation timeout
When the original reviewer submits their decision before the timeout
Then the escalation is cancelled
And the document proceeds through normal approval flow

scenarios.scenario_name: Concurrent approval and rejection by different reviewers

executions.scenario_name: Concurrent approval and rejection by different reviewers

steps.description: Given a document in "review" status with multiple reviewers
When one reviewer approves and another rejects simultaneously
Then the rejection takes precedence
And the document status changes to "rejected"

scenarios.scenario_name: Resubmit rejected document creates new review cycle

executions.scenario_name: Resubmit rejected document creates new review cycle

steps.description: Given a document in "rejected" status
When the author resubmits the document
Then the document status changes to "review"
And a new review cycle is created with fresh reviewer assignments
And previous review history is preserved

scenarios.scenario_name: Reviewer who is also the author cannot approve own document

executions.scenario_name: Reviewer who is also the author cannot approve own document

steps.description: Given a user who is both the author and an assigned reviewer
When they attempt to approve the document
Then the approval is rejected
And an error is returned indicating self-approval is not permitted

scenarios.scenario_name: Submit document with no reviewers assigned returns error

executions.scenario_name: Submit document with no reviewers assigned returns error

steps.description: Given a document in "draft" status
When the author submits the document with no reviewers assigned
Then the submission is rejected
And an error is returned indicating at least one reviewer is required
